acceptedAnswer.text: ICOs allow projects to raise capital by selling new tokens, which may offer benefits to investors but do not usually confer ownership rights.
STOs offer a regulated approach to token sales, tying tokens to real assets or company revenue, and comply with securities regulations to enhance transparency and investor protection.
IEOs are conducted on cryptocurrency exchanges where projects are vetted, and tokens are sold to platform users, enhancing credibility and reaching retail investors.

mainEntity.name: What is the purpose and benefits of token lockups?

acceptedAnswer.text: Token lockups ensure market stability, foster long-term commitment, and increase investor confidence by restricting token transfers post-issuance.

mainEntity.name: What are the types of token lockups?

acceptedAnswer.text: Types include Fixed-Term Lockups, Vesting Schedules, and Strategic Releases.

mainEntity.name: What challenges do blockchain projects face?

acceptedAnswer.text: Challenges include regulatory hurdles, market volatility, and trust/security issues.

mainEntity.name: What strategic recommendations can help blockchain projects?

acceptedAnswer.text: Recommendations include maintaining transparency, ensuring balanced lockup durations, providing milestone updates, and adhering to compliance.
